title: Police: Man Shot To Death In Stockton Related To 3-Year-Old Killed By Stray Bullet
content:
2 p.m. UPDATE: Stockton Police have identified the man shot and killed on Tuesday night in Stockton as 32-year-old Jose Nunez.
McDonald’s has put forward $15,000 toward information leading to the death Nunez, who was an employee.
—-
STOCKTON (CBS13) – Stockton police say that a man shot and killed Tuesday night in Stockton is related to a 3-year-old girl who was killed by a stray bullet in a car.
Officers were called to Madrid Drive near Farmington Road around 9 p.m. There they found a 32-year-old unidentified man with a gunshot wound outside of a home. He was rushed to a hospital in Modesto where he died.
Stockton Police say the victim is a relative of Melanie Martinez, the 3-year-old girl who was shot and killed by a stray bullet in South Stockton last week.
Police are not sure how the two victims are related.
Police do not have any suspects or a possible motive in either case.
Crime Stoppers is offering a reward of up to $20,000 for any information that leads to an arrest in the shooting of Melanie.
